extendedIngredients.name: tart apples
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 medium sweet-tart apples, such as Braeburn, peeled and cut into 12 wedges each (4 lb.)
metaInformation: such as braeburn, peeled and cut into 12 wedges each (4 lb.)

recipes.title: Upside-Down Apple-Cinnamon Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Pie on the menu? Try pairing with Lambrusco Dolce, Late Harvest Riesling, and Vin Santo. These wines are all sweet, which is important since wine should usually be sweeter than the food you're pairing with it. You could try Angel Late Harvest Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Angel Late Harvest Riesling
productMatches.description: Messina Hof's Angel is a crisp, sweet dessert wine, harvested from the last pick of Riesling when the grapes are almost raisins. Perfect with fruit, cheesecake and light, sweet chocolate desserts.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350˚F. Spread sugar in even layer over bottom of 10-inch cast-iron or ovenproof skillet (not nonstick), and heat over medium-low heat. Cook 12 to 15 minutes, or until sugar has caramelized to a pale amber color, stirring often with wooden spoon. Remove from heat.Toss apple wedges with lemon juice and cinnamon in bowl. Arrange apple wedges flat-side down in concentric circles in skillet over caramel. Roll crust into 10-inch disc. Place dough over apples, folding edges inward to make a rim but covering apples completely. Make 2 to 3 small slits in dough to let steam escape while baking. Bake 1 hour 45 minutes to 2 hours, or until crust is golden brown.Cool 15 minutes on wire rack. Run knife around edges, then place large cake plate over skillet, and invert pie onto cake plate. Transfer any apples remaining in skillet into pie and smooth with knife.

steps.step: Spread sugar in even layer over bottom of 10-inch cast-iron or ovenproof skillet (not nonstick), and heat over medium-low heat. Cook 12 to 15 minutes, or until sugar has caramelized to a pale amber color, stirring often with wooden spoon.
Remove from heat.Toss apple wedges with lemon juice and cinnamon in bowl. Arrange apple wedges flat-side down in concentric circles in skillet over caramel.
Place dough over apples, folding edges inward to make a rim but covering apples completely. Make 2 to 3 small slits in dough to let steam escape while baking.
Bake 1 hour 45 minutes to 2 hours, or until crust is golden brown.Cool 15 minutes on wire rack. Run knife around edges, then place large cake plate over skillet, and invert pie onto cake plate.
Transfer any apples remaining in skillet into pie and smooth with knife.
